{"type":"radiogroup","name":"consent_survey","title":"Your participation is voluntary but strongly encouraged. Do you consent to completing this survey?","isRequired":true,"choices":[{"value":"yes","text":"Yes"},{"value":"no","text":"Yo"}]}

{"type":"html","name":"survey_preamble_header_and_text","html":"

{workshop_course} Academic Year Workshop Post-Survey

Congratulations! You've completed a Code.org {workshop_course} Academic Year Workshop!

This survey asks questions about your experience today. 

Privacy and Confidentiality

  • Your individual responses here are completely confidential.
  • Your identity will never be revealed publicly or used to tie any responses back to you personally.
  • We may share de-identified, aggregate data (representing all responses) publicly.
  • Your de-identified responses will be used by Code.org, our Regional Partners, and our facilitators for program improvement.

This survey should take less than 10 minutes to complete.  Your complete honesty and candor are appreciated.

"}
{"type":"html","name":"thank_you_heading","html":"\u003ch2\u003eThank you!\u003c/h2\u003e"}
{"type":"html","name":"workshop_experience_header","html":"\u003ch2\u003eYour {workshop_course} Workshop Experience\u003c/h2\u003e"}

{"type":"matrix","name":"codedotorg_teaching_strategies_csd","title":"Right now, I have concrete teaching strategies to...","questionTitleLocation":"hidden","visibleIf":"{workshop_course} = 'CS Discoveries'","columns":[{"value":"0","text":"N/A"},{"value":"1","text":"1"},{"value":"2","text":"2"},{"value":"3","text":"3"},{"value":"4","text":"4"},{"value":"5","text":"5"},{"value":"6","text":"6"},{"value":"7","text":"7"}],"rows":[{"value":"work_collaboratively","text":"ensure that students work collaboratively."},{"value":"equitable_discussion","text":"ensure that every student has a daily opportunity to share ideas and be heard by classmates through partnered conversations, or small-group or large-group discussions."},{"value":"normalize_failure","text":"create a culture in which problems or failures are normalized and welcomed as a natural part of the problem solving process."},{"value":"journaling","text":"provide frequent opportunities for students to do reflective writing as a way to promote sense-making and self-expression."},{"value":"regular_feedback","text":"create a classroom culture in which students regularly get feedback on their work."},{"value":"cs_vocab","text":"support student understanding and use of CS vocabulary."},{"value":"differentiate_instruction","text":"differentiate instruction to meet student needs."},{"value":"problem_solving_autonomy","text":"create a culture in which students know where to find and how to use resources to support problem solving."}]}

{"type":"matrix","name":"codedotorg_teaching_strategies_csp","title":"Right now, I have concrete teaching strategies to...","visibleIf":"{workshop_course} = 'CS Principles'","questionTitleLocation":"hidden","columns":[{"value":"0","text":"N/A"},{"value":"1","text":"1"},{"value":"2","text":"2"},{"value":"3","text":"3"},{"value":"4","text":"4"},{"value":"5","text":"5"},{"value":"6","text":"6"},{"value":"7","text":"7"}],"rows":[{"value":"pair_programming","text":"ensure that students work collaboratively when writing code."},{"value":"peer_feedback","text":"create a classroom culture in which students regularly get feedback on their work from their peers."},{"value":"equitable_discussion","text":"ensure that every student has a daily opportunity to share ideas and be heard by classmates through partnered conversations, small-group, or large-group discussions. "},{"value":"normalize_failure","text":"create a culture in which problems or failures are normalized and welcomed as a natural part of the problem solving process."},{"value":"journaling","text":"provide frequent opportunities for students to do reflective writing as a way to promote sense-making and self-expression."},{"value":"cs_vocab","text":"support student understanding and use of CS vocabulary."},{"value":"impacts_of_tech","text":"support students in becoming informed decision makers about the impact of technology."}]}

{"type":"matrix","name":"cs_community","title":"How much do you agree or disagree with the following statements about your computer science teaching community?","columns":[{"value":"1","text":"Strongly Disagree"},{"value":"2","text":"Disagree"},{"value":"3","text":"Slightly Disagree"},{"value":"4","text":"Neutral"},{"value":"5","text":"Slightly Agree"},{"value":"6","text":"Agree"},{"value":"7","text":"Strongly Agree"}],"rows":[{"value":"someone_to_turn_to","text":"When I need help teaching computer science, I have someone to turn to."},{"value":"know_teacher_leaders","text":"I know computer science teacher-leaders and role models in my community."},{"value":"part_of_cs_movement","text":"I feel like I'm part of a broad computer science education movement."},{"value":"see_rp_as_resource","text":"I see my Regional Partner as a resource and support for computer science education in my community."},{"value":"excited_to_collaborate","text":"I am excited to collaborate with other computer science teachers in my community."}]}

{"type":"panel","name":"instructional_focus_panel","elements":[{"type":"html","name":"instructional_focus_statements","html":"
Statement A Statement B
Instruction and class activities should focus on maintaining high standards and rigor so that students reach the highest level of achievement, even if some students struggle with the material. Instruction and class activities should focus on ensuring that students with the least prior knowledge and preparation are not left behind, even if that means that less material can be covered.
"},{"type":"rating","name":"instructional_focus","title":"Instructional focus. 1. more material,some students struggle --- 5. less material, leave fewer behind","titleLocation":"hidden","minRateDescription":"Strongly aligned with A","maxRateDescription":"Strongly aligned with B"}]}

{"type":"html","name":"instructional_focus_statements","html":"
Statement A Statement B
Instruction and class activities should focus on maintaining high standards and rigor so that students reach the highest level of achievement, even if some students struggle with the material. Instruction and class activities should focus on ensuring that students with the least prior knowledge and preparation are not left behind, even if that means that less material can be covered.
"}

{"type":"panel","name":"lead_learner_panel","elements":[{"type":"html","name":"lead_learner_statements","html":"
Statement A Statement B
"I do not need to have deep expertise in computer science in order to successfully teach it. I have expertise in how to learn, and I can model that for my students as we learn the content together." "As the teacher, I need to have deep content expertise so that I can properly answer students’ questions and guide instruction appropriately."
"},{"type":"rating","name":"lead_learner","title":"Lead Learner. 1. model expertise in how to learn  --- 5. need deep content expertise","titleLocation":"hidden","minRateDescription":"Strongly aligned with A","maxRateDescription":"Strongly aligned with B"}]}

{"type":"html","name":"lead_learner_statements","html":"
Statement A Statement B
"I do not need to have deep expertise in computer science in order to successfully teach it. I have expertise in how to learn, and I can model that for my students as we learn the content together." "As the teacher, I need to have deep content expertise so that I can properly answer students’ questions and guide instruction appropriately."
"}

{"type":"panel","name":"pairs_of_statements_instructions","elements":[{"type":"html","name":"question3","html":"\u003ch2\u003eTeaching Philosophy\u003c/h2\u003e"},{"type":"html","name":"rating_description","html":"\u003cp\u003eBelow are pairs of statements from computer science teachers describing various philosophies or approaches to teaching, presented as \u003cstrong\u003eStatement A\u003c/strong\u003e and \u003cstrong\u003eStatement B \u003c/strong\u003elike so:  \u003c/p\u003e  \u003cdiv class='foorm-survey-rating-question-sample'\u003e\u003cimg src='/shared/images/foorm/foorm_rating_question_sample.png'/\u003e\u003c/div\u003e Please \u003cb\u003eselect the value 1-5\u003c/b\u003e that best shows how closely your own beliefs are to one of the statements in a given pair.\n\nPlease respond freely based on your \u003cb\u003epersonal beliefs\u003c/b\u003e and philosophy - there is no right or wrong way to respond."}]}

{"type":"html","name":"pd_survey_preamble","html":"

Code.org {workshop_course} Professional Learning Program Pre-Survey

Welcome to the program!

Code.org relies on surveys as a crucial tool through which we remain connected to teachers, and to give you the opportunity to provide feedback about our curriculum and your teaching experience, as well as to improve our programs.

Privacy and Confidentiality

  • Your individual responses here are completely confidential.
  • Your identity will never be revealed publicly or used to tie any responses back to you personally.
  • We may share anonymous, aggregate data (representing all responses) publicly.
  • Your anonymized responses will be used by Code.org, our Regional Partners, and our facilitators for program improvement.

Your honesty and candor are appreciated.

"}

{"type":"panel","name":"prioritize_time_panel","elements":[{"type":"html","name":"prioritize_time_statements","html":"
Statement A Statement B
It’s important that the teacher prioritize their time and resources for students who have the most need. The teacher should ensure that their time, and students’ access to resources are distributed equally for all.
"},{"type":"rating","name":"prioritize_time","title":"Prioritize Time. 1. prioritize most need --- 5. distribute equally","titleLocation":"hidden","minRateDescription":"Strongly aligned with A","maxRateDescription":"Strongly aligned with B"}]}

{"type":"html","name":"prioritize_time_statements","html":"
Statement A Statement B
It’s important that the teacher prioritize their time and resources for students who have the most need. The teacher should ensure that their time, and students’ access to resources are distributed equally for all.
"}

{"type":"panel","name":"recruit_responsibility_panel","elements":[{"type":"html","name":"recruit_responsibility_statements","html":"
Statement A Statement B
Computer science teachers’ responsibility is to promote their computer science classes broadly, to all students. The diversity of the class will reflect those most interested in taking a computer science class. Computer science teachers have a responsibility to recruit a set of students into their classrooms that are representative of the school’s population in terms of diversity (gender, racial, socio-economic, etc.)
"},{"type":"rating","name":"recruit_responsibility","title":"Recruit Responsibility. 1. recruit students interested in CS  --- 5. recruit representative population","titleLocation":"hidden","minRateDescription":"Strongly aligned with A","maxRateDescription":"Strongly aligned with B"}]}

{"type":"html","name":"summer_workshop_daily_preamble","html":"\u003ch2\u003e{workshop_course} Summer Workshop - Day {day}\u003c/h2\u003e\u003cp\u003eWe're eager to hear how you're doing and what your facilitator(s) can do to improve, so we ask that you please take 5-10 minutes to complete this survey.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eYour feedback will be shared with your facilitator(s), {regional_partner_name} and the Code.org staff.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eThank you for your time and honesty!\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e"}

{"type":"html","name":"true_of_me_now_scale_expl","html":"

Self-assessment of Computer Science Teaching Practices

Please use the "true of me now" scale to self-assess your current knowledge and skills teaching computer science. Please think about how true it is that you can do certain things in terms of your own development and preparation for teaching computer science right now.  

 
N/A 1----2 3----4----5 6----7
Irrelevant Not true of me now
 not well prepared, need more development
 Somewhat true of me now
somewhat prepared, in process developing		 Very true of me now
well prepared, current strengths

Below, we ask the degree to which you believe you have concrete teaching strategies. A concrete teaching strategy is a specific teaching technique, method, or named practice that you could describe or demonstrate to another teacher right now, if asked.

"}

{"type":"matrix","name":"identity_and_dei","title":"Please rate the extent to which you agree or disagree with the following statements.","columns":[{"value":"1","text":"Strongly Disagree"},{"value":"2","text":"Disagree"},{"value":"3","text":"Slightly Disagree"},{"value":"4","text":"Neutral"},{"value":"5","text":"Slightly Agree"},{"value":"6","text":"Agree"},{"value":"7","text":"Strongly Agree"}],"rows":[{"value":"identity_impacts_interactions","text":"My identity impacts my interactions with students."},{"value":"understand_who_has_access","text":"As a result of this workshop, I better understand who has access to CS in my community."},{"value":"identify_barriers","text":"As a result of this workshop, I am better able to identify barriers to access, diversity, and inclusion in my CS classroom."},{"value":"impact_barriers","text":"As a result of this workshop, I am better able to impact the barriers to access, diversity, and inclusion that students face in my CS classroom. {"type":"html","name":"pd_post_survey_preamble","html":"

{workshop_course} Summer Workshop Post-Survey

Congratulations! You've completed the Code.org {workshop_course} Summer workshop!

This survey asks questions about your experience today and the workshop as a whole. 

Privacy and Confidentiality

  • Your individual responses here are completely confidential.
  • Your identity will never be revealed publicly or used to tie any responses back to you personally.
  • We may share de-identified, aggregate data (representing all responses) publicly.
  • Your de-identified responses will be used by Code.org, our Regional Partners, and our facilitators for program improvement.

This survey should take about 10 minutes to complete.  Your complete honesty and candor are appreciated.

"}

{"type":"radiogroup","name":"permission_to_quote","title":"I give the workshop organizer permission to quote my written comments from today for use on social media, promotional materials, and other communications.","choices":[{"value":"yes","text":"Yes, I give the workshop organizer permission to quote me and use my name."},{"value":"yes_anon","text":"Yes, I give the workshop organizer permission to quote me, but I want to be anonymous."},{"value":"no","text":"No, I do not give the workshop organizer my permission."}]}
